reviews.text: excellent hotel for the price.small room,but with comfortable bed,chest of drawers,cable tv,closet,sink.fridge,microwave,desk and nightstand.shared shower and bathroom. (separate) never had to wait. all impecably clean. nice friendly staff.lobby w. wifi. i paid 360.00 for 7 nights including tax. great deal unless you want to spend your time in sanfran in a hotel room! otherwise,a great value for anyone on a budget who is satisfied with a no major frills accomodations.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: I am still currently staying at this hotel while writing this review, hearing all kinds of noises through their old windows: from bus squeking, to people yelling at each other, to friends just talking. Who would call this place quiet? I saw some reviews mentioning that word...
reviews.title: Smelly, noisy, quite ridiculous indeed

reviews.text: The first stroke I got when I just entered this hotel from the street (I thought the street was smelly..). So, the smell all over the hotel is such as if all the carpets have been peed on from the lobby to the third floor, and I am usually not a princess type of a customer..
reviews.title: Classy, Cool, Clean, & Classic

reviews.text: All windows in the corridors were open (and it wasn't particularly warm) to get rid of the smell, but I doubt that helps.. The room looked decent (!) until I discovered there is no bathroom in the room, and it is just on the floor. Hmhmhm.. There is no coffee pot in the room, but there is a phone - obviously this hotel is for super busy people who value phone conversations in a smelly room more than a cup of a hot beverage in the morning, or even such a luxury as a bathroom in the room.
reviews.title: A great landing for San Francisco for the budget conscious

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is just one shower cabin for the whole floor of about 30 rooms. I was wondering how long I would have to wait in line. Phew! It was vacant! So happy I was until I discovered the tap in the shower room is hard to be kept at one point. It is so loose so it always slides to either very hot or radically cold. How entertaining.
reviews.title: Didnt like very much

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I recently did a road trip around California. We were on a budget and opted for cheap and cheerful accommodation; somewhere to put our heads down for a night or 2. We appreciate that you get what you pay for and so would have been happy as long as it was clean and functional.
reviews.title: Cheap and cheerful!

reviews.text: The North Beach Hotel was absolutely fine. The hotel staff were friendly enough and the room was clean albeit tiny. It was a double room with a shared bathroom. The room was just about big enough for the 2 of us and our bags but there wasn't much room left for manoeuvre. But then we literally needed somewhere to sleep for night so it was absolutely fine.
reviews.title: Nice location but that's it

reviews.text: There was a weird smell but that would be my only other complaint.
reviews.title: Actually a very good place to stay!

reviews.text: The location was fantastic, we walked to all the attractions and there are some fantastic restaurants in the area.
reviews.title: Overpriced

reviews.text: Given that it was heaps cheaper than any other accommodation we could find in San Fran we were really happy with the North Beach. Great location, no frills but a clean and functional room.
reviews.title: Good location in the heart of SF

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is no better area to stay in San Francisco than North Beach and the Hotel North Beach is in the perfect location. China Town is right round the corner so there are always an array of cheap eats on offer. If you're interested in the 'beat scene' then there are several historically important places only minutes away. Be sure to visit Vesuvio's Bar and City Lights Book store. There are various bars and restaurants nearby, every evening we were spoilt for choice.
reviews.title: Great place...

reviews.text: Fisherman's Wharf is only about 20 minutes walk away and there is a metro station nearby too. There is a place downstairs called 'Happy Donut' which does amazing breakfasts at low prices.
reviews.title: Too many mediocre experiences with this hotel - will not return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself gets a bad write up from some other travellers for no reason at all as far as I am concerned, most have basically not done their homework before booking. Yes, it's an old building but that adds to it's charm and if you walk up and down the hallways you see lots of quirky little features. Our room was small but spotless and we had a fridge, microwave and cable TV. Our towels were changed and our beds were made on a daily basis. It's a little noisy in the room at night but the hotel is in the middle of the city so that's to be expected.
reviews.title: Basic hotel in a great location at an affordable price

reviews.text: There were at least 4 shared bathrooms / showers on our floor and they were kept spotless at all times. No complaints there at all.
reviews.title: If you want cheap and well placed but don't care about the rest. Stay here

reviews.text: There are longer term residents staying in the hotel but everyone was really friendly and polite, we didn't encounter a single problem with the residents in the week we stayed.
reviews.title: This is a great place to stay in terms of location and cheaper room rates compare to other nearby similar hotels.

reviews.text: ive stayed at this hotel many times over the coors of maybe saaayyyyyy 7 yrs and it just gets bettr! my simple criteria for any hotel is as follows: it should be clean(no crazy smells)...friendly and comfy.all this in the hart of north beach?....loll..ya just cant beat it! all the basic amenities to enjoy yor stay.now to be fair the staff wud do well to wear vests to identify them.that alwaayyssss helps!still,gr8 spot!
reviews.title: excellent!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: u can walk down the stree to the Bart station or Pier 39 within 15mins, so honestly,it's good location, but that's all. the room's very small that u even can't open your case on the space. and you have to pay $30 cash as the key deposit.overprice ,in one word.
reviews.title: the most terrible stay in US

reviews.text: I really enjoyed the classic quaintness of the hotel, the reception area is cozy and the internet access is great. The receptionists were at all times friendly and extremely efficient and helpful. I arrived from a very long journey from India at an odd time, the room was not available before the afternoon. I could freshen up and change and leave my luggage safely while I ventured out. It was actually the best thing I could do to combat jet lag.
reviews.title: Enjoyed the classic quaintness of the hotel

reviews.text: There is no restaurant but the nearby cafe "happy Donut" and restaurants and bars - the legendary Vésuvio", "City lights bookstore" make up for it. The rooms are indeed small and the bathrooms were in the corridor but you are not in san Francisco to stay in your room all day. And there are quite many restrooms and showers very reasonably clean on each floor!
reviews.title: Good cheap Accomodation

reviews.text: Location is great within walking distance of several areas of interest like China Town or Little Italy, Market place and within a few steps of a bus going to Fisherman's wharf.The shuttle bus back and to the airport is 17 $ one way and very convenient.
reviews.title: Cheap and close to transport
